Description: Bronze axe: five holes in the blade. Its lateral tangs taper rather than expand towards the butt. The cutting end is turned and blunted through heavy use. All corrosion product has been cleaned off. There is surface pitting along the cutting edge, and triangular punch-marks are present near the edge on one face.
Curator's comments: Metallographic analysis has shown that after casting the blade was worked and annealed, the latter process being carried out at a relatively low temperature.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (80)
